main event: An unidentified flying object was observed at Ft Bragg, North Carolina, on May 16, 1958, appearing slightly larger than Mars and moving at a high speed.
interesting points: The object was reported as round and red-orange, moving on a steady path before fading from sight into clouds., The sighting was observed by at least two individuals, with one estimating the duration as 2 minutes and the other as 5 minutes., The observer was a Doctor of Psychology associated with the American Embassy in the Hague., No confirmation of satellite track, but it was considered characteristic of an orbital observation., The sighting is thought to possibly be related to the known satellite 1958 Gamma or Sputnik III.
witness description: Doctor of Psychology and a Lt. Colonel in the military
